GTC Extensions (Stable)

Functions and types that GLSL does not provide, but are useful to have. More...

Modules

 Half Float Core Extension
 

Defines the half-float type, along with various typedefs for vectors and matrices.


 Matrix Access Core Extension
 

Defines functions that allow you to access rows or columns of a matrix easily.


 Integer Matrix Core Extension
 

Defines a number of matrices with integer types.


 Matrix Inverse Core Extension
 

Defines additional matrix inverting functions.


 Matrix Transform Core Extension
 

Defines functions that generate common transformation matrices.


 Quaternion Core Extension
 

Defines a templated quaternion type and several quaternion operations.


 Type Precision Core Extension
 

Defines specific C++-based precision types.


 Pointer Access Core Extension
 

Used to get a pointer to the memory layout of a basic type.


Detailed Description

Functions and types that GLSL does not provide, but are useful to have.

Core extensions differ from experimental extensions in that core extensions are fairly stable. The API for experimental extensions is expected to change significantly between versions.

Even if it's highly unrecommended, you can bring all of the extensions, by including <glm/ext.hpp>. Otherwise, you will have to include each extension by including a specific file.
